job.title: Machine Learning Engineer

They are backed by some of the biggest technology companies in the United States. They are combining robotic systems, computer vision, and deep learning to change both academic and industry settings.THE ROLE â MACHINE LEARNING ENGINEERIn this role,Â you will be working cross-functionally to improve and deploy machine learning and deep learning models into production.You will be training and deploying machine learning models into productionYou will be working with PyTorch to deploy deep learning models onto embedded systemsYou will be doing distributing training, model optimization, and model benchmarkingYou will work cross-functionally with the research and engineer team to further the research and development of their ai systems in roboticsÂ YOUR SKILLS AND EXPERIENCEÂ Commercial experience working with robotics or autonomous vehiclesExperience with distributing training, model measurement, and model optimizationExperience training and deploying machine learning and deep learning modelsExperience working on GPUs and CPUsExperience working with TVM, Asic, FPGA or XlaA Masterâs degree in computer science or a related fieldÂ BENEFITSÂ As a Machine Learning Engineer, you can expect to earn up to $170,000 (depending on experience) along with competitive benefits.Â HOW TO APPLYPlease register your interest by sending your resume to Mitchell Resor via the apply link on this pageÂ KEYWORDS:Â | Computer Vision | 3D | Robotics | Image Processing| Computer Vision | Image Analysis | Image Reconstruction | GPU| Cuda | TensorFlow | C++ | Keras |PyTorch |AI| machine learning | deep learning | SLAM | robots | artificial intelligence
